info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 14 at 12:28AM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...AREAS OF FOG DEVELOPING ACROSS THE RIO GRANDE VALLEY TONIGHT... At 12:20 AM, Areas of fog are developing across portions of the Rio Grande Valley tonight. Visibilities of 1 to 3 miles in general can be expected with these areas of fog. Some locally dense fog may develop later tonight into early Tuesday morning reducing visibilities to a quarter of a mile or less. A Dense Fog Advisory may be needed overnight into early Tuesday morning if the visibilities continue to worsen over the Rio Grande Valley. At 12:20 AM, the visibilities in Harlingen have dropped to a half of a mile in some areas while visibilities in Edinburg have dropped to 3 miles. A Dense Fog Advisory remains in effect for Jim Hogg, Brooks and Kenedy Counties until 9 AM Tuesday. Motorists should be aware of locally dense fog with visibility changing rapidly over short distances. Use low beam headlights and leave extra distance between your vehicle and others on the road.
